wikipedia_page.main: Alexander Noble Hall (3 December 1880 – 25 September 1943), sometimes known as Sandy Hall, was a Scottish professional footballer who played as a centre forward in the Scottish League for Dunfermline Athletic, Dundee, Motherwell and St Bernard's. He was a part of Canada's gold medal-winning 1904 Olympic team and finished the tournament as joint-top scorer, with three goals.
